intro: Podolobium aciculare, commonly known as the needleleaf podolobium, is a flowering plant species native to southern Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, which are often borne on short peduncles. Its seeds are enclosed in pods that split open when mature, releasing the seeds to the environment. Podolobium aciculare is adapted to arid and semi-arid conditions, making it a resilient component of its native ecosystems.
